name: brave-search_brave_web_search
description: Performs a web search using the Brave Search API, ideal for general queries, news, articles, and online content. Use this for broad information gathering, recent events, or when you need diverse web sources. Supports pagination, content filtering, and freshness controls. Maximum 20 results per request, with offset for pagination.

name: brave-search_brave_local_search
description:
Searches for local businesses and places using Brave's Local Search API. Best for queries related to physical locations, businesses, restaurants, services, etc. Returns detailed information including:
- Business names and addresses
- Ratings and review counts
- Phone numbers and opening hours
Use this when the query implies 'near me' or mentions specific locations. Automatically falls back to web search if no local results are found.

query.description: Local search query (e.g. 'pizza near Central Park')

name: calculator_calculate
description: Calculates/evaluates the given expression.

name: clinicaltrialsgov-mcp-server_clinicaltrials_get_study
description: Fetches one or more clinical studies from ClinicalTrials.gov by their NCT IDs. Returns either complete study data or concise summaries for each.

nctIds.description: A single NCT ID or an array of up to 5 NCT IDs. Each must follow the format 'NCT' followed by 8 digits (e.g., 'NCT12345678').

markupFormat.description: Specifies the format for rich text fields in the response. Defaults to 'markdown'.

fields.description: An optional list of specific top-level fields to include in the response. If omitted, all fields are returned.

summaryOnly.description: If true, returns a condensed summary of the study instead of the full data. Defaults to false.

name: clinicaltrialsgov-mcp-server_clinicaltrials_list_studies
description: Searches for clinical studies using a combination of query terms and filters. Supports pagination, sorting, and geographic filtering.

term.description: Search for other terms like interventions, outcomes, or sponsors.

titles.description: Search within study titles or acronyms.

intr.description: Search for specific interventions or treatments.

id.description: Search for study identifiers (e.g., NCT ID).

query.description: A set of search terms that influence result ranking.

ids.description: Return only studies with the specified NCT IDs.

overallStatus.description: Filter results by one or more study statuses.

geo.description: Filter results to a geographic area by providing a point and radius.

advanced.description: Apply an advanced filter using Essie expression syntax.

filter.description: A set of filters that narrow the search results without affecting ranking.

fields.description: A list of specific top-level fields to include in the response.

sort.description: Specify the sort order for the results.

pageSize.description: The number of studies to return per page (1-1000). Defaults to 5.

pageToken.description: A token used to retrieve the next page of results.

countTotal.description: If true, includes the total count of matching studies in the response.

name: clinicaltrialsgov-mcp-server_clinicaltrials_analyze_trends
description: Performs a statistical analysis on a set of clinical trials, aggregating data by status, country, sponsor, or phase. Use specific query parameters to refine the analysis and filter the studies included in the analysis. The tool can handle up to 5000 studies per analysis.

term.description: Search for other terms like interventions, outcomes, or sponsors.

titles.description: Search within study titles or acronyms.

intr.description: Search for specific interventions or treatments.

id.description: Search for study identifiers (e.g., NCT ID).

query.description: A set of search terms that influence result ranking.

ids.description: Return only studies with the specified NCT IDs.

overallStatus.description: Filter results by one or more study statuses.

geo.description: Filter results to a geographic area by providing a point and radius.

advanced.description: Apply an advanced filter using Essie expression syntax.

filter.description: A set of filters that narrow the search results without affecting ranking.

analysisType.description: The type of statistical analysis to perform on the study set.

name: dicom-mcp_list_dicom_nodes
description:
List all configured DICOM nodes and their connection information.
        
        This tool returns information about all configured DICOM nodes in the system
        and shows which node is currently selected for operations. It also provides
        information about available calling AE titles.
        
        Returns:
            Dictionary containing:
            - current_node: The currently selected DICOM node name
            - nodes: List of all configured node names
        
        Example:
            {
                "current_node": "pacs1",
                "nodes": ["pacs1", "pacs2", "orthanc"],
            }

name: dicom-mcp_extract_pdf_text_from_dicom
description:
Retrieve a DICOM instance with encapsulated PDF and extract its text content.
        
        This tool retrieves a DICOM instance containing an encapsulated PDF document,
        extracts the PDF, and converts it to text. This is particularly useful for
        medical reports stored as PDFs within DICOM format (e.g., radiology reports,
        clinical documents).
        
        Args:
            study_instance_uid: The unique identifier for the study (required)
            series_instance_uid: The unique identifier for the series within the study (required)
            sop_instance_uid: The unique identifier for the specific DICOM instance (required)
        
        Returns:
            Dictionary containing:
            - success: Boolean indicating if the operation was successful
            - message: Description of the operation result or error
            - text_content: The extracted text from the PDF (if successful)
            - file_path: Path to the temporary DICOM file (for debugging purposes)
        
        Example:
            {
                "success": true,
                "message": "Successfully extracted text from PDF in DICOM",
                "text_content": "Patient report contents...",
                "file_path": "/tmp/tmpdir123/1.2.3.4.5.6.7.8.dcm"
            }

name: dicom-mcp_switch_dicom_node
description:
Switch the active DICOM node connection to a different configured node.
        
        This tool changes which DICOM node (PACS, workstation, etc.) subsequent operations
        will connect to. The node must be defined in the configuration file.
        
        Args:
            node_name: The name of the node to switch to, must match a name in the configuration
        
        Returns:
            Dictionary containing:
            - success: Boolean indicating if the switch was successful
            - message: Description of the operation result or error
        
        Example:
            {
                "success": true,
                "message": "Switched to DICOM node: orthanc"
            }
        
        Raises:
            ValueError: If the specified node name is not found in configuration

name: dicom-mcp_verify_connection
description:
Verify connectivity to the current DICOM node using C-ECHO.
        
        This tool performs a DICOM C-ECHO operation (similar to a network ping) to check
        if the currently selected DICOM node is reachable and responds correctly. This is
        useful to troubleshoot connection issues before attempting other operations.
        
        Returns:
            A message describing the connection status, including host, port, and AE titles
        
        Example:
            "Connection successful to 192.168.1.100:104 (Called AE: ORTHANC, Calling AE: CLIENT)"

name: dicom-mcp_query_patients
description:
Query patients matching the specified criteria from the DICOM node.
        
        This tool performs a DICOM C-FIND operation at the PATIENT level to find patients
        matching the provided search criteria. All search parameters are optional and can
        be combined for more specific queries.
        
        Args:
            name_pattern: Patient name pattern (can include wildcards * and ?), e.g., "SMITH*"
            patient_id: Patient ID to search for, e.g., "12345678"
            birth_date: Patient birth date in YYYYMMDD format, e.g., "19700101"
            attribute_preset: Controls which attributes to include in results:
                - "minimal": Only essential attributes
                - "standard": Common attributes (default)
                - "extended": All available attributes
            additional_attributes: List of specific DICOM attributes to include beyond the preset
            exclude_attributes: List of DICOM attributes to exclude from the results
        
        Returns:
            List of dictionaries, each representing a matched patient with their attributes
        
        Example:
            [
                {
                    "PatientID": "12345",
                    "PatientName": "SMITH^JOHN",
                    "PatientBirthDate": "19700101",
                    "PatientSex": "M"
                }
            ]
        
        Raises:
            Exception: If there is an error communicating with the DICOM node

name: dicom-mcp_query_studies
description:
Query studies matching the specified criteria from the DICOM node.
        
        This tool performs a DICOM C-FIND operation at the STUDY level to find studies
        matching the provided search criteria. All search parameters are optional and can
        be combined for more specific queries.
        
        Args:
            patient_id: Patient ID to search for, e.g., "12345678"
            study_date: Study date or date range in DICOM format:
                - Single date: "20230101"
                - Date range: "20230101-20230131"
            modality_in_study: Filter by modalities present in study, e.g., "CT" or "MR"
            study_description: Study description text (can include wildcards), e.g., "CHEST*"
            accession_number: Medical record accession number
            study_instance_uid: Unique identifier for a specific study
            attribute_preset: Controls which attributes to include in results:
                - "minimal": Only essential attributes
                - "standard": Common attributes (default)
                - "extended": All available attributes
            additional_attributes: List of specific DICOM attributes to include beyond the preset
            exclude_attributes: List of DICOM attributes to exclude from the results
        
        Returns:
            List of dictionaries, each representing a matched study with its attributes
        
        Example:
            [
                {
                    "StudyInstanceUID": "1.2.840.113619.2.1.1.322.1600364094.412.1009",
                    "StudyDate": "20230215",
                    "StudyDescription": "CHEST CT",
                    "PatientID": "12345",
                    "PatientName": "SMITH^JOHN",
                    "ModalitiesInStudy": "CT"
                }
            ]
        
        Raises:
            Exception: If there is an error communicating with the DICOM node

name: dicom-mcp_query_series
description:
Query series within a study from the DICOM node.
        
        This tool performs a DICOM C-FIND operation at the SERIES level to find series
        within a specified study. The study_instance_uid is required, and additional
        parameters can be used to filter the results.
        
        Args:
            study_instance_uid: Unique identifier for the study (required)
            modality: Filter by imaging modality, e.g., "CT", "MR", "US", "CR"
            series_number: Filter by series number
            series_description: Series description text (can include wildcards), e.g., "AXIAL*"
            series_instance_uid: Unique identifier for a specific series
            attribute_preset: Controls which attributes to include in results:
                - "minimal": Only essential attributes
                - "standard": Common attributes (default)
                - "extended": All available attributes
            additional_attributes: List of specific DICOM attributes to include beyond the preset
            exclude_attributes: List of DICOM attributes to exclude from the results
        
        Returns:
            List of dictionaries, each representing a matched series with its attributes
        
        Example:
            [
                {
                    "SeriesInstanceUID": "1.2.840.113619.2.1.1.322.1600364094.412.2005",
                    "SeriesNumber": "2",
                    "SeriesDescription": "AXIAL 2.5MM",
                    "Modality": "CT",
                    "NumberOfSeriesRelatedInstances": "120"
                }
            ]
        
        Raises:
            Exception: If there is an error communicating with the DICOM node

name: dicom-mcp_query_instances
description:
Query individual DICOM instances (images) within a series.
        
        This tool performs a DICOM C-FIND operation at the IMAGE level to find individual
        DICOM instances within a specified series. The series_instance_uid is required,
        and additional parameters can be used to filter the results.
        
        Args:
            series_instance_uid: Unique identifier for the series (required)
            instance_number: Filter by specific instance number within the series
            sop_instance_uid: Unique identifier for a specific instance
            attribute_preset: Controls which attributes to include in results:
                - "minimal": Only essential attributes
                - "standard": Common attributes (default)
                - "extended": All available attributes
            additional_attributes: List of specific DICOM attributes to include beyond the preset
            exclude_attributes: List of DICOM attributes to exclude from the results
        
        Returns:
            List of dictionaries, each representing a matched instance with its attributes
        
        Example:
            [
                {
                    "SOPInstanceUID": "1.2.840.113619.2.1.1.322.1600364094.412.3001",
                    "SOPClassUID": "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.2",
                    "InstanceNumber": "45",
                    "ContentDate": "20230215",
                    "ContentTime": "152245"
                }
            ]
        
        Raises:
            Exception: If there is an error communicating with the DICOM node

name: dicom-mcp_move_series
description:
Move a DICOM series to another DICOM node.
        
        This tool transfers a specific series from the current DICOM server to a 
        destination DICOM node.
        
        Args:
            destination_node: Name of the destination node as defined in the configuration
            series_instance_uid: The unique identifier for the series to be moved
        
        Returns:
            Dictionary containing:
            - success: Boolean indicating if the operation was successful
            - message: Description of the operation result or error
            - completed: Number of successfully transferred instances
            - failed: Number of failed transfers
            - warning: Number of transfers with warnings
        
        Example:
            {
                "success": true,
                "message": "C-MOVE operation completed successfully",
                "completed": 120,
                "failed": 0,
                "warning": 0
            }

name: dicom-mcp_move_study
description:
Move a DICOM study to another DICOM node.
        
        This tool transfers an entire study from the current DICOM server to a 
        destination DICOM node.
        
        Args:
            destination_node: Name of the destination node as defined in the configuration
            study_instance_uid: The unique identifier for the study to be moved
        
        Returns:
            Dictionary containing:
            - success: Boolean indicating if the operation was successful
            - message: Description of the operation result or error
            - completed: Number of successfully transferred instances
            - failed: Number of failed transfers
            - warning: Number of transfers with warnings
        
        Example:
            {
                "success": true,
                "message": "C-MOVE operation completed successfully",
                "completed": 256,
                "failed": 0,
                "warning": 0
            }

name: dicom-mcp_get_attribute_presets
description:
Get all available attribute presets for DICOM queries.
        
        This tool returns the defined attribute presets that can be used with the
        query_* functions. It shows which DICOM attributes are included in each
        preset (minimal, standard, extended) for each query level.
        
        Returns:
            Dictionary organized by query level (patient, study, series, instance),
            with each level containing the attribute presets and their associated
            DICOM attributes.
        
        Example:
            {
                "patient": {
                    "minimal": ["PatientID", "PatientName"],
                    "standard": ["PatientID", "PatientName", "PatientBirthDate", "PatientSex"],
                    "extended": ["PatientID", "PatientName", "PatientBirthDate", "PatientSex", ...]
                },
                "study": {
                    "minimal": ["StudyInstanceUID", "StudyDate"],
                    "standard": ["StudyInstanceUID", "StudyDate", "StudyDescription", ...],
                    "extended": ["StudyInstanceUID", "StudyDate", "StudyDescription", ...]
                },
                ...
            }

description: Get overall usage statistics for all sessions

query.description: The text string or JavaScript-style regular expression to search for (case-insensitive). Example: 'heart attack|myocardial infarction|mi'. Best for finding specific text/keywords or variations across *all* record parts (FHIR+notes). Use regex with `|` for related terms (e.g., `'diabetes|diabetic'`).

resource_types.description:
Optional list to filter the search scope. Supports FHIR resource type names (e.g., "Patient", "Observation") and the special keyword "Attachment".
        Behavior based on the list:
        - **If omitted or an empty list is provided:** Searches EVERYTHING - all FHIR resources and all attachment plaintext.
        - **List contains only FHIR types (e.g., ["Condition", "Procedure"]):** Searches ONLY the specified FHIR resource types AND the plaintext of attachments belonging *only* to those specified resource types.
        - **List contains only ["Attachment"]:** Searches ONLY the plaintext content of ALL attachments, regardless of which resource they belong to.
        - **List contains FHIR types AND "Attachment" (e.g., ["DocumentReference", "Attachment"]):** Searches the specified FHIR resource types (e.g., DocumentReference) AND the plaintext of ALL attachments (including those not belonging to the specified FHIR types).

resource_format.description: Determines the output format for matching FHIR *resources*. 'plaintext' (default): Shows the rendered plaintext representation of the resource. 'json': Shows the full FHIR JSON of the resource. Matching *attachments* always show plaintext snippets.

page_size.description: Number of hits to display per page (1-50). Defaults to 50.

page.description: Page number to display. Defaults to 1.

sql.description: The read-only SQL SELECT statement to execute against the in-memory FHIR data. FHIR resources are stored in the 'fhir_resources' table with columns 'resource_type', 'resource_id', and 'json'. For example, 'SELECT json FROM fhir_resources WHERE resource_type = "Patient"' or 'SELECT json FROM fhir_resources WHERE resource_type = "Observation" AND json LIKE "%diabetes%"'. Best for precisely selecting specific FHIR resources or fields using known structure (e.g., Observations by LOINC). Limited to structured FHIR data.

resourceId.description: The ID of the FHIR resource.

resourceType.description: The FHIR resource type the attachment belongs to.

resourceId.description: The ID of the FHIR resource the attachment belongs to.

attachmentPath.description: The JSON path within the source resource where the attachment is located (e.g., 'content.attachment', 'photo[0]'). Provided by the grep tool.

includeRawBase64.description: Set to true to include the raw base64 content in the response. Defaults to false.

name: medicaid-mcp_medicaid_info
description: Unified tool for Medicaid data operations: access enrollment trends, drug pricing (NADAC), quality measures, and program performance from data.medicaid.gov via Socrata SODA API. Provides state-level aggregates (NOT provider-level like Medicare).

method.description: The operation to perform: get_nadac_pricing (drug pricing), compare_drug_pricing (multi-drug comparison), get_enrollment_trends (state enrollment), compare_state_enrollment (multi-state comparison), get_drug_rebate_info (rebate program), search_state_formulary (CA/NY/TX/OH/IL formularies), get_drug_utilization (state prescriptions), get_federal_upper_limits (FUL pricing), list_available_datasets (catalog), search_datasets (custom query)

states.description: Array of state abbreviations for compare_state_enrollment

drug_name.description: Drug name (partial match supported) for get_nadac_pricing or get_drug_rebate_info

price_date.description: Specific pricing date (YYYY-MM-DD) for get_nadac_pricing - defaults to latest

enrollment_type.description: Type of enrollment data for enrollment methods

ndc_codes.description: Array of NDC codes for compare_drug_pricing

drug_names.description: Array of drug names for compare_drug_pricing

name: nexonco-mcp_search_clinical_evidence
description: Perform a flexible search for clinical evidence using combinations of filters such as disease, therapy, molecular profile, phenotype, evidence type, and direction. This flexible search system allows you to tailor your query based on the data needed for research or clinical decision-making. It returns a detailed report that includes summary statistics, a top 10 evidence listing, citation sources, and a disclaimer.

disease_name.description: Name of the disease to filter evidence by (e.g., 'Von Hippel-Lindau Disease', 'Lung Non-small Cell Carcinoma', 'Colorectal Cancer', 'Chronic Myeloid Leukemia', 'Glioblastoma'..). Case-insensitive and optional.
disease_name.title: Disease Name

therapy_name.description: Therapy or drug name involved in the evidence (e.g., 'Cetuximab', 'Imatinib', 'trastuzumab', 'Lapatinib'..). Optional.
therapy_name.title: Therapy Name

molecular_profile_name.description: Molecular profile or gene name or variant name (e.g., 'EGFR L858R', 'BRAF V600E', 'KRAS', 'PIK3CA'..). Optional.
molecular_profile_name.title: Molecular Profile Name

phenotype_name.description: Name of the phenotype or histological subtype (e.g., 'Hemangioblastoma', 'Renal cell carcinoma', 'Retinal capillary hemangioma', 'Pancreatic cysts', 'Childhood onset'..). Optional.
phenotype_name.title: Phenotype Name

evidence_direction.description: Direction of the evidence: 'SUPPORTS' or 'DOES_NOT_SUPPORT'. Indicates if the evidence favors the association.
evidence_direction.title: Evidence Direction

filter_strong_evidence.description: If set to True, only evidence with a rating above 3 will be included, indicating high-confidence evidence. However, the number of returned evidence items may be quite low.
filter_strong_evidence.title: Filter Strong Evidence

name: npi-registry_search_npi_registry
description:
Search the National Provider Identifier (NPI) registry.

The NPI registry contains information about healthcare providers and organizations
in the United States. You can search by various criteria including name, NPI number,
location, and specialty.

WILDCARD SUPPORT: Most text fields support wildcard searches using '*' after at least
2 characters for fuzzy matching (e.g., 'smith*', 'hosp*', 'cardi*').

Args:
    first_name: Provider's first name (supports wildcards: 'john*' matches 'John', 'Johnny', etc.)
    last_name: Provider's last name (supports wildcards: 'smith*' matches 'Smith', 'Smithson', etc.)
    organization_name: Organization name (supports wildcards: 'hosp*' matches 'Hospital', 'Hospice', etc.)
    npi: Specific 10-digit NPI number to look up (exact match only)
    city: City name (supports wildcards: 'san*' matches 'San Francisco', 'San Diego', etc.)
    state: State abbreviation (e.g., 'CA', 'NY', 'TX') - exact match only
    postal_code: ZIP/postal code (supports wildcards: '902*' matches '90210', '90211', etc.)
    specialty: Provider specialty or taxonomy (supports wildcards: 'cardi*' matches 'Cardiology', 'Cardiac Surgery', etc.)
    limit: Maximum number of results to return (1-200, default: 10)

Examples:
    - Find all Smiths: last_name='smith*'
    - Find hospitals: organization_name='hosp*'
    - Find cardiologists: specialty='cardio*'
    - Find providers in San cities: city='san*'
    - Find providers in 90210 area: postal_code='902*'

Returns:
    Dictionary containing search results with provider information

name: weather_get_current_weather
description: Get current weather conditions for a location in the United States. Perfect for 'What's the weather like in [US location]?' questions. Covers all US states, territories, and coastal waters.

location.description: US location as coordinates (lat,lng) in decimal degrees. Example: '40.7128,-74.0060' for New York City. Must be within US boundaries including states, territories (PR, VI, AS, GU, MP), and coastal waters.

name: weather_get_weather_forecast
description: Get multi-day weather forecast for a location in the United States. Perfect for 'What's the forecast for [US location]?' questions. Provides detailed day/night forecasts for up to 7 days.

location.description: US location as coordinates (lat,lng) in decimal degrees. Example: '40.7128,-74.0060' for New York City. Must be within US boundaries including states, territories (PR, VI, AS, GU, MP), and coastal waters.

days.description: Number of days to forecast (1-7, default 7). Each day includes both day and night periods.

name: weather_get_hourly_forecast
description: Get hour-by-hour weather forecast for a location in the United States. Perfect for 'What's the hourly forecast?' or 'Will it rain this afternoon in [US location]?' questions. Provides detailed hourly conditions for up to 48 hours.

location.description: US location as coordinates (lat,lng) in decimal degrees. Example: '40.7128,-74.0060' for New York City. Must be within US boundaries including states, territories (PR, VI, AS, GU, MP), and coastal waters.

hours.description: Number of hours to forecast (1-48, default 24). Provides temperature, conditions, and precipitation probability for each hour.

name: weather_get_weather_alerts
description: Get active weather alerts, warnings, watches, and advisories for locations in the United States. Perfect for 'Are there any weather alerts in [US location]?' questions. Covers severe weather, winter storms, heat warnings, flood alerts, and more.

location.description: US location as coordinates (lat,lng) in decimal degrees OR 2-letter state/territory code. Examples: '40.7128,-74.0060' for New York City, 'CA' for California, 'PR' for Puerto Rico. Valid state codes: AL, AK, AS, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DE, DC, FL, GA, GU, HI, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, ME, MD, MA, MI, MN, MS, MO, MT, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, ND, OH, OK, OR, PA, PR, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VT, VI, VA, WA, WV, WI, WY, MP, PW, FM, MH.

severity.description: Filter by alert severity: 'extreme' (life-threatening), 'severe' (significant threat), 'moderate' (possible threat), 'minor' (minimal threat), or 'all' (default - shows all active alerts).

name: weather_find_weather_stations
description: Find weather observation stations near a location in the United States. Useful for getting station-specific data, finding data sources, or understanding which stations provide weather data for an area. Includes ASOS, AWOS, and other automated weather stations.

location.description: US location as coordinates (lat,lng) in decimal degrees. Example: '40.7128,-74.0060' for New York City. Must be within US boundaries including states, territories (PR, VI, AS, GU, MP), and coastal waters.

limit.description: Maximum number of stations to return (1-20, default 10). Stations are returned ordered by distance from the specified location.

name: weather_get_local_time
description: Get the current local time for a US location. Shows what time it is right now at the specified location.

location.description: US location as coordinates (lat,lng) in decimal degrees. Example: '40.7128,-74.0060' for New York City.

name: alphafold_batch_structure_info
description: Get structure information for multiple proteins simultaneously

name: alphafold_batch_download
description: Download multiple structure files

name: alphafold_batch_confidence_analysis
description: Analyze confidence scores for multiple proteins

name: alphafold_compare_structures
description: Compare multiple AlphaFold structures for analysis

uniprotIds.description: Array of UniProt accessions to compare (2-10)

name: alphafold_find_similar_structures
description: Find AlphaFold structures similar to a given protein

name: alphafold_get_coverage_info
description: Get information about sequence coverage in the AlphaFold prediction

name: alphafold_validate_structure_quality
description: Validate and assess the overall quality of an AlphaFold prediction

name: alphafold_export_for_pymol
description: Export structure data formatted for PyMOL visualization

name: alphafold_export_for_chimerax
description: Export structure data formatted for ChimeraX visualization

name: alphafold_get_api_status
description: Check AlphaFold API status and database statistics

name: strava_connect_strava
description:
Connect/link your Strava account. In mock mode, this always succeeds
    and returns the default user connection status.

name: strava_check_strava_connection
description:
Verify current Strava authentication status.
    Returns connection status and basic athlete info.

name: strava_get_strava_profile
description:
Retrieve the authenticated athlete's profile information.
    Returns details like name, location, premium status, and profile pictures.

name: strava_get_training_zones
description:
Get the athlete's heart rate and power training zones.
    Returns configured zones for heart rate (5 zones) and power (7 zones).

name: strava_get_recent_activities
description:
Get a list of recent activities with optional filtering.

    Args:
        page: Page number for pagination (default 1)
        per_page: Number of activities per page (default 30, max 200)
        activity_type: Filter by activity type (Run, Ride, Swim, etc.)
        after: Only activities after this date (ISO 8601 format)
        before: Only activities before this date (ISO 8601 format)

name: strava_get_activity_details
description:
Get comprehensive details for a specific activity.

    Args:
        activity_id: The unique identifier of the activity

    Returns detailed information including distance, time, speed, heart rate,
    power data, achievements, and more.

name: strava_get_activity_laps
description:
Get lap-by-lap breakdown for an activity.

    Args:
        activity_id: The unique identifier of the activity

    Returns detailed lap data including time, distance, pace, heart rate,
    and power for each lap.

name: strava_get_activity_streams
description:
Fetch time-series data streams for an activity.

    Args:
        activity_id: The unique identifier of the activity
        keys: Comma-separated list of stream types to retrieve.
              Options: time, distance, altitude, heartrate, cadence, watts,
              velocity_smooth, grade_smooth, latlng

    Returns compact time-series data for analysis and visualization.

name: strava_get_activity_photos
description:
Retrieve photos attached to an activity.

    Args:
        activity_id: The unique identifier of the activity

    Returns photo metadata including URLs for different sizes.

name: strava_get_athlete_stats
description:
Get year-to-date and all-time statistics for the athlete.

    Returns aggregated totals for runs, rides, and swims including
    distance, time, elevation, and achievement counts.

name: strava_get_activity_totals
description:
Get aggregated distance and time totals by activity type.

    Returns summary statistics grouped by activity type (Run, Ride, etc.).

name: strava_get_personal_records
description:
Get the athlete's personal records and best performances.

    Returns PRs for various distances and segments including
    fastest 5K, 10K, half marathon, etc.

name: strava_get_starred_segments
description:
Get the athlete's starred/favorite segments.

    Returns a list of segments the athlete has marked as favorites.

name: strava_find_nearby_segments
description:
Find popular segments near a location.

    Args:
        lat: Latitude of the center point
        lng: Longitude of the center point
        radius: Search radius in meters (default 5000)
        activity_type: Filter by 'running' or 'riding'

name: strava_get_segment_details
description:
Get detailed information about a specific segment.

    Args:
        segment_id: The unique identifier of the segment

    Returns segment details including distance, grade, elevation,
    location, and leaderboard information.

name: strava_star_segment
description:
Star/favorite a segment to save it to your list.

    Args:
        segment_id: The unique identifier of the segment to star

name: strava_get_segment_efforts
description:
Get your effort history on a specific segment.

    Args:
        segment_id: The unique identifier of the segment

    Returns all your attempts on the segment with times, rankings, and achievements.

name: strava_get_saved_routes
description:
Get a list of routes you've created or saved.

    Returns route summaries including name, distance, elevation, and estimated time.

name: strava_get_route_details
description:
Get detailed information about a specific route.

    Args:
        route_id: The unique identifier of the route

    Returns full route details including map data.

name: strava_export_route_gpx
description:
Export a route in GPX format for use with GPS devices.

    Args:
        route_id: The unique identifier of the route

    Returns GPX XML content that can be saved to a file.

name: strava_export_route_tcx
description:
Export a route in TCX (Training Center XML) format.

    Args:
        route_id: The unique identifier of the route

    Returns TCX XML content that can be saved to a file.

name: strava_get_athlete_clubs
description:
Get a list of clubs the athlete is a member of.

    Returns club details including name, sport type, location, and membership status.

name: strava_reset
description:
Reset the Strava mock server to initial state.
    Clears all data and reloads from CSV files.

name: strava_show_data
description:
Show summary of available mock data.
    Returns counts of athletes, activities, segments, routes, and clubs.

name: amazon-shop_get-orders-history
description:
Get orders history for a user.

    Returns order history including order status, items purchased, and totals.

    Returns:
        JSON string containing list of recent orders with:
        - Order status (pending, shipped, delivered, cancelled)
        - Items in each order with prices
        - Order totals and shipping address

name: amazon-shop_get-cart-content
description:
Get the current cart content for a user.

    Always provide the product link when you mention a product in the response.

    Returns:
        JSON string containing cart items with product details,
        quantities, subtotals, and cart total.

name: amazon-shop_add-to-cart
description:
Add a product to the Amazon cart using ASIN.

    You should always ask for confirmation to the user before running this tool.

    Args:
        asin: The ASIN (Amazon Standard Identification Number) of the product to add to cart.
              Must be a 10-character string.

    Returns:
        Success or failure message.

name: amazon-shop_clear-cart
description:
Clear all items from the Amazon cart.

    Returns:
        Confirmation message.

name: amazon-shop_get-product-details
description:
Get detailed information about a product using its ASIN.

    Always provide the product link when you mention a product in the response.

    Args:
        asin: The ASIN (Amazon Standard Identification Number) of the product to get details for.
              Must be a 10-character string.

    Returns:
        JSON string containing full product details including title, description,
        price, brand, category, rating, review count, stock status, and Prime eligibility.

name: amazon-shop_search-products
description:
Search for products on Amazon using a search term.

    Returns a list of products matching the search term.
    Always provide the product link when you mention a product in the response.

    Args:
        searchTerm: The search term to look for products on Amazon.
                    For example: "collagen", "laptop", "books"

    Returns:
        JSON string containing list of matching products with ASIN, title,
        description, price, rating, and product URL.

name: amazon-shop_perform-purchase
description:
Checkout with the current cart and complete the purchase.

    Before purchasing, you should verify in the cart content that you are not buying
    another product that was already there. If there are other products, clear the cart
    then add the items that the user wants to buy again to the cart.

    You should always ask for confirmation to the user before running this tool.

    Returns:
        Purchase confirmation message.

name: amazon-shop_get-current-user
description:
Get the current logged-in user's profile information.

    Returns information about the currently authenticated user including
    their name, email, shipping address, and Prime membership status.

    Returns:
        JSON string containing user profile with:
        - User ID and name
        - Email and phone
        - Default shipping address
        - Prime membership status

name: amazon-shop_show_data
description:
Shows the current data in the Amazon database.

    Useful for debugging and exploring available products and orders.

    Args:
        data_type: Type of data to show - "products", "cart", "orders", or "all"
        limit: Maximum number of records to return

    Returns:
        JSON string with the requested data.

name: amazon-shop_reset
description:
Resets the Amazon database to its initial state.

    Reloads all data from CSV files, clears the cart, and restores sample orders.

    Returns:
        Confirmation message.

name: librelink_get_current_glucose
description:
Get the current glucose reading with trend information.

Returns the most recent glucose measurement including:
- Current glucose value (mg/dL)
- Timestamp of measurement
- Trend direction (rising, falling, stable)
- Trend arrow indicator
- Status (Low, Normal, High)
- Color code for status

name: librelink_get_glucose_history
description:
Get glucose history for a specified time period.

Args:
    hours: Number of hours of history to retrieve (default: 24, max: 168)

Returns glucose readings over the specified period including:
- List of readings with values, timestamps, and trends
- Total reading count
- Period duration

name: librelink_get_glucose_stats
description:
Get glucose statistics and metrics for a specified period.

Args:
    days: Number of days to analyze (default: 7, max: 90)

Returns statistical analysis including:
- Average glucose
- Glucose Management Indicator (GMI/estimated HbA1c)
- Time in range percentages (below/in/above target)
- Variability metrics (standard deviation, coefficient of variation)
- Total reading count

name: librelink_get_glucose_trends
description:
Analyze glucose patterns and trends over time.

Args:
    period: Analysis period - "daily", "weekly", or "monthly"

Returns pattern analysis including:
- Detected patterns (e.g., dawn phenomenon)
- Dawn phenomenon analysis (overnight vs morning averages)
- Overnight stability metrics
- Estimated meal response averages

name: librelink_get_sensor_info
description:
Get information about active CGM sensors.

Returns sensor details including:
- Serial number
- Model name
- Activation date
- Expiration date
- Days remaining
- Status

name: librelink_reset
description:
Reset the CGM data to initial state.

Reloads all data from CSV files, clearing any modifications.

name: genetics_get_current_user
description: Get the current authenticated user's basic info.

name: genetics_get_genetic_profile
description:
Get the current user's complete genetic profile summary.

Includes ancestry composition, haplogroups, and variants analyzed.

name: genetics_get_health_risks
description:
Get health risk predispositions based on genetic data.

Args:
    category: Filter by risk category (cardiovascular, metabolic, cancer, etc.)
    risk_level: Filter by specific risk level
    elevated_only: If True, only return elevated/high risk conditions

Returns:
    List of health risks with genetic scores, population comparisons, and recommended actions

name: genetics_get_health_risk_detail
description:
Get detailed information about a specific health risk condition.

Args:
    condition_name: Name of the condition (e.g., "Type 2 Diabetes", "Coronary Artery Disease")

Returns:
    Detailed risk information including genetic variants, recommendations, and ICD-10 code

name: genetics_get_pharmacogenomics
description:
Get pharmacogenomics (drug-gene interaction) results.

Shows how your genetics affect drug metabolism and efficacy.

Args:
    gene: Filter by specific gene (e.g., "CYP2C19", "CYP2D6")
    actionable_only: If True, only return results that require clinical action

Returns:
    Pharmacogenomics results with phenotype, affected drugs, and clinical recommendations

name: genetics_check_drug_interaction
description:
Check if a specific drug has pharmacogenomic interactions for the current user.

Use this before prescribing or taking a medication to check for genetic factors
that may affect drug safety or efficacy.

Args:
    drug_name: Name of the drug to check (e.g., "clopidogrel", "codeine", "warfarin")

Returns:
    Any genetic factors affecting this drug, with clinical recommendations

name: genetics_get_carrier_status
description:
Get carrier status for recessive genetic conditions.

Important for family planning - carriers can pass conditions to children
if both parents are carriers.

Args:
    positive_only: If True, only return conditions where user is a carrier

Returns:
    Carrier status results with inheritance patterns and family planning relevance

name: genetics_get_recommended_screenings
description:
Get recommended health screenings based on genetic profile.

These are medical tests and consultations recommended based on your genetic risk factors.

Args:
    priority: Filter by priority level (high, medium, low)
    screening_type: Filter by type (blood_test, imaging, specialist_consult, etc.)

Returns:
    Recommended screenings with reasons, frequency, CPT codes, and specialist types

name: genetics_get_genetic_counseling_needs
description:
Determine if genetic counseling is recommended based on the user's genetic profile.

Evaluates health risks, carrier status, and pharmacogenomics to identify
situations where professional genetic counseling would be beneficial.

Returns:
    Assessment of genetic counseling needs with specific reasons

name: genetics_get_actionable_summary
description:
Get a summary of all actionable genetic findings.

Provides a consolidated view of findings that may require medical attention,
lifestyle changes, or further testing.

Returns:
    Summary of elevated health risks, drug interactions, carrier status, and recommended screenings

name: genetics_reset
description:
Reset the genetics database to initial state.

Clears any modifications and reloads from original CSV data.

name: renpho_get_latest_measurement
description:
Get the most recent body composition measurement.

Returns the latest reading from your Renpho smart scale including:
- Weight (kg)
- BMI
- Body fat percentage
- Muscle mass
- Water percentage
- Bone mass
- Visceral fat level
- Metabolic age
- BMR (Basal Metabolic Rate)

name: renpho_get_body_composition
description:
Get detailed body composition analysis with health classifications.

Returns comprehensive body metrics with health status indicators:
- All measurement values (weight, BMI, body fat, muscle mass, etc.)
- BMI classification (Underweight/Normal/Overweight/Obese)
- Body fat classification (Athletes/Fitness/Average/Obese)
- Visceral fat classification (Healthy/Elevated/High)
- Metabolic age comparison to actual age

name: renpho_get_weight_trend
description:
Analyze weight trend over a specified time period.

Args:
    days: Number of days to analyze (default: 7, range: 7-365)

Returns weight trend analysis including:
- Start and end weights
- Total weight change (kg and percentage)
- Average, minimum, and maximum weights
- Trend direction (losing/stable/gaining)
- Number of measurements in period

name: renpho_get_measurements
description:
Get historical body composition measurements.

Args:
    start_date: Filter measurements from this date (ISO format, e.g., "2024-01-01")
    end_date: Filter measurements until this date (ISO format)
    limit: Maximum number of measurements to return (default: 30, max: 100)

Returns a list of measurements with all body composition metrics,
ordered by date (most recent first).

name: renpho_get_current_user
description:
Get the current user's Renpho profile information.

Returns user profile including:
- Email and nickname
- Height and gender
- Birthday (if set)
- Goal weight
- Unit system preference
- Connected scale devices

name: renpho_health_check
description:
Verify connection to the Renpho API.

Returns connection status and API information.
For the mock server, this always returns success.

name: renpho_reset
description:
Reset the Renpho data to initial state.

Reloads all data from CSV files, clearing any modifications.

name: whoop_get_profile
description:
Get the current user's WHOOP profile.

Returns basic profile information including:
- User ID
- Email
- First and last name

name: whoop_get_body_measurement
description:
Get the user's body measurements.

Returns body measurement data including:
- Height (meters)
- Weight (kilograms)
- Max heart rate

name: whoop_get_cycle
description:
Get a specific physiological cycle by ID.

Args:
    cycle_id: The unique identifier of the cycle

Returns cycle data including:
- Start and end times
- Strain score (0-21 scale)
- Calories burned (kilojoules)
- Heart rate metrics

name: whoop_get_cycle_collection
description:
Get a collection of physiological cycles.

Args:
    start_date: Filter cycles from this date (ISO format)
    end_date: Filter cycles until this date (ISO format)
    limit: Maximum number of cycles to return (default: 25, max: 100)

Returns a list of cycles with strain, calories, and heart rate data,
sorted by start time (most recent first).

name: whoop_get_recovery_for_cycle
description:
Get recovery data for a specific cycle.

Args:
    cycle_id: The unique identifier of the cycle

Returns recovery metrics including:
- Recovery score (0-100%)
- Resting heart rate
- HRV (Heart Rate Variability) in milliseconds
- SpO2 (blood oxygen) percentage
- Skin temperature
- Recovery state (green/yellow/red)

name: whoop_get_recovery_collection
description:
Get a collection of recovery records.

Args:
    start_date: Filter recovery from this date (ISO format)
    end_date: Filter recovery until this date (ISO format)
    limit: Maximum number of records to return (default: 25, max: 100)

Returns a list of recovery records with HRV, resting HR, SpO2,
and recovery scores, sorted by timestamp (most recent first).

name: whoop_get_sleep
description:
Get a specific sleep record by ID.

Args:
    sleep_id: The unique identifier of the sleep record

Returns detailed sleep data including:
- Sleep stages (light, deep/SWS, REM, awake)
- Sleep performance and efficiency scores
- Respiratory rate
- Sleep cycles and disturbances

name: whoop_get_sleep_for_cycle
description:
Get sleep data for a specific cycle.

Args:
    cycle_id: The unique identifier of the cycle

Returns the main sleep record (not naps) for the given cycle.

name: whoop_get_sleep_collection
description:
Get a collection of sleep records.

Args:
    start_date: Filter sleep from this date (ISO format)
    end_date: Filter sleep until this date (ISO format)
    limit: Maximum number of records to return (default: 25, max: 100)

Returns a list of sleep records with stages, scores, and metrics,
sorted by start time (most recent first). Includes both main sleeps
and naps.

name: whoop_get_workout
description:
Get a specific workout by ID.

Args:
    workout_id: The unique identifier of the workout

Returns detailed workout data including:
- Sport type
- Strain score
- Heart rate metrics (average, max)
- Calories burned (kilojoules)
- Time in each heart rate zone

name: whoop_get_workout_for_cycle
description:
Get workouts for a specific cycle.

Args:
    cycle_id: The unique identifier of the cycle

Returns all workouts recorded during the given cycle.

name: whoop_get_workout_collection
description:
Get a collection of workout records.

Args:
    start_date: Filter workouts from this date (ISO format)
    end_date: Filter workouts until this date (ISO format)
    limit: Maximum number of records to return (default: 25, max: 100)

Returns a list of workout records with strain, heart rate zones,
and calorie data, sorted by start time (most recent first).

name: whoop_health_check
description:
Verify connection to the WHOOP API.

Returns connection status and API information.
For the mock server, this always returns success.

name: whoop_reset
description:
Reset the WHOOP data to initial state.

Reloads all data from CSV files, clearing any modifications.

name: myfitnesspal_get_current_user_profile
description:
Get the current user's profile and nutrition goals.

Returns the user profile including personal info and daily nutrition targets.
The active user is determined by the ACTIVE_PERSONA environment variable.

Returns:
    User profile with goals for calories, macros, and water intake.

name: myfitnesspal_get_daily_summary
description:
Get a comprehensive daily nutrition summary.

Provides an overview of the day including:
- Calorie intake vs goal (food calories, exercise calories, net calories)
- Macronutrient totals (protein, carbs, fat)
- Water intake progress
- Exercise summary

Args:
    date: Date to get summary for (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

Returns:
    Daily summary with calories, macros, water, and exercise totals.

name: myfitnesspal_get_daily_meals
description:
Get meal-by-meal food breakdown for a day.

Returns detailed food entries organized by meal type:
- Breakfast
- Lunch
- Dinner
- Snacks

Each food entry includes name, serving size, and full nutritional content.

Args:
    date: Date to get meals for (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

Returns:
    Meals breakdown with individual food entries and per-meal totals.

name: myfitnesspal_get_daily_exercise
description:
Get exercise activities logged for a day.

Returns all exercise entries including:
- Activity name and category
- Duration in minutes
- Calories burned
- MET value (metabolic equivalent)

Args:
    date: Date to get exercises for (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

Returns:
    Exercise log with individual activities and totals.

name: myfitnesspal_get_daily_macros
description:
Get comprehensive macro and micronutrient breakdown.

Provides detailed nutritional analysis including:
- Macros: protein, carbs, fat (grams, calories, percentage)
- Carb breakdown: fiber, sugar
- Fat breakdown: saturated, trans
- Micronutrients: sodium, cholesterol, potassium, vitamins

Args:
    date: Date to get macros for (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

Returns:
    Detailed macro and micronutrient breakdown with goal comparisons.

name: myfitnesspal_get_water_intake
description:
Get water consumption data for a day.

Returns water intake tracking including:
- Individual water log entries
- Total consumption (ml, oz, cups, liters)
- Progress toward daily goal
- Remaining amount to reach goal

Args:
    date: Date to get water intake for (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

Returns:
    Water intake data with totals, goals, and progress percentage.

name: myfitnesspal_get_date_range_summary
description:
Get aggregate nutrition statistics across a date range.

Provides totals and daily averages for:
- Calories (food and exercise)
- Macronutrients (protein, carbs, fat)
- Water intake
- Exercise duration

Useful for analyzing weekly or monthly nutrition trends.

Args:
    start_date: Start date of range (YYYY-MM-DD format). Required.
    end_date: End date of range (YYYY-MM-DD format). Defaults to today.

Returns:
    Aggregate totals, daily averages, and entry counts for the date range.

name: myfitnesspal_search_foods
description:
Search the food database by name.

Find foods to log by searching the database. Results include
full nutritional information per serving.

Args:
    query: Search term to match against food names.
    limit: Maximum number of results (default 20, max 50).

Returns:
    List of matching foods with nutritional data.

name: myfitnesspal_search_exercises
description:
Search the exercise database by name.

Find exercises to log by searching the database. Results include
calorie burn rates and MET values.

Args:
    query: Search term to match against exercise names.
    limit: Maximum number of results (default 20, max 50).

Returns:
    List of matching exercises with calorie data.

name: myfitnesspal_health_check
description:
Verify connection to MyFitnessPal.

Returns connection status and API information.
For the mock server, this always returns success.

Returns:
    Connection status and server information.

name: myfitnesspal_reset
description:
Reset MyFitnessPal data to initial state.

Reloads all data from CSV files, clearing any modifications.

Returns:
    Confirmation of reset.

name: fitbit_get_user_profile
description:
Get the current user's Fitbit profile information.

Returns user details including display name, date of birth, gender,
height, weight, stride lengths, timezone, and membership status.

name: fitbit_get_user_settings
description:
Get the current user's Fitbit account settings.

Returns locale, timezone, units, and display preferences.

name: fitbit_get_devices
description:
Get all Fitbit devices associated with the current user.

Returns device details including name, type, version, battery level,
and last sync time.

name: fitbit_get_badges
description:
Get all achievement badges earned by the current user.

Returns badges with details including name, description, category,
date earned, and achievement value.

name: fitbit_get_activities
description:
Get activity/workout logs for the current user.

Args:
    start_date: Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format (optional)
    end_date: End date in YYYY-MM-DD format (optional)
    limit: Maximum number of activities to return (default 20)

Returns activities with details including name, type, duration,
calories, steps, distance, and heart rate data.

name: fitbit_get_steps
description:
Get step count data for the current user.

Args:
    date: Target date in YYYY-MM-DD format (default: today)
    period: Time period - "1d", "7d", "30d", "1w", or "1m"

Returns daily step counts for the specified period.

name: fitbit_get_distance
description:
Get distance traveled data for the current user.

Args:
    date: Target date in YYYY-MM-DD format (default: today)
    period: Time period - "1d", "7d", "30d", "1w", or "1m"

Returns daily distance data for the specified period.

name: fitbit_get_calories
description:
Get calories burned data for the current user.

Args:
    date: Target date in YYYY-MM-DD format (default: today)
    period: Time period - "1d", "7d", "30d", "1w", or "1m"

Returns daily calorie data including total, BMR, and active calories.

name: fitbit_get_active_zone_minutes
description:
Get Active Zone Minutes (AZM) data for the current user.

Args:
    date: Target date in YYYY-MM-DD format (default: today)
    period: Time period - "1d", "7d", "30d", "1w", or "1m"

Returns daily active zone minutes including fat burn, cardio, and peak zones.

name: fitbit_get_floors_climbed
description:
Get floors climbed data for the current user.

Args:
    date: Target date in YYYY-MM-DD format (default: today)
    period: Time period - "1d", "7d", "30d", "1w", or "1m"

Returns daily floors climbed data.

name: fitbit_get_heart_rate
description:
Get heart rate data for the current user.

Args:
    date: Target date in YYYY-MM-DD format (default: today)
    period: Time period - "1d", "7d", "30d", "1w", or "1m"

Returns heart rate summary including resting heart rate and
time spent in each heart rate zone (out of range, fat burn, cardio, peak).

name: fitbit_get_body_measurements
description:
Get body measurement data for the current user.

Args:
    date: Target date in YYYY-MM-DD format (default: today)
    period: Time period - "1d", "7d", "30d", "1w", or "1m"

Returns body measurements including weight, BMI, body fat percentage,
and lean mass.

name: fitbit_get_sleep_logs
description:
Get sleep log data for the current user.

Args:
    date: Specific date in YYYY-MM-DD format (optional)
    start_date: Start of date range in YYYY-MM-DD format (optional)
    end_date: End of date range in YYYY-MM-DD format (optional)

If no arguments provided, returns last 7 days of sleep data.

Returns sleep logs with details including duration, time asleep,
efficiency, and sleep stages (deep, light, REM, wake).

name: azure-fhir_search_fhir
description:
Search FHIR resources using comprehensive Azure FHIR search capabilities.

Supports resource-specific and common search parameters, modifiers, prefixes, chained searches, 
and result management. Returns paginated results in FHIR searchset bundles.

Key Features:
 Resource-specific and common search parameters (_id, _lastUpdated, _tag, etc.)
 Search modifiers (:missing, :exact, :contains, :text, :not, etc.)
 Prefixes for ordered parameters (gt, lt, ge, le, etc.)
 Chained searches (e.g., Encounter?subject:Patient.name=Jane)
 Reverse chained searches using _has parameter
 Include and revinclude searches (_include, _revinclude)
 Result parameters (_count, _sort, _elements, _summary, _total)
 Composite search parameters for complex queries
 Pagination support with configurable page sizes (max 1000)

Args:
    resource_type: FHIR resource type to search (e.g., 'Patient', 'Observation', 'Condition')
    search_params: Dictionary of FHIR search parameters. Common examples:
         {"name": "Smith", "_count": 50} - Search patients by name, limit 50 results
         {"birthdate": "gt1990-01-01", "_sort": "birthdate"} - Patients born after 1990, sorted
         {"identifier": "12345", "_include": "Patient:general-practitioner"} - Include GP
         {"code": "77386006", "_include": "Observation:subject"} - Pregnancy observations with patients
         {"_lastUpdated": "gt2024-01-01"} - Resources updated after date
    ctx: MCP Context for logging and progress reporting

Returns:
    List of matching FHIR resources extracted from searchset Bundle

name: opennutrition_search-food-by-name
title: Search food by name
description:
MANDATORY: Use this tool ANY time you need to search for foods by name, synonym, or partial name. If a user provides a food name (common, brand, or alternate) or requests foods by name, you MUST use this tool. Not using this tool in these scenarios is an error. Do NOT use for non-food queries.

Use cases (MUST use this tool):
- Users asking for foods by common, brand, or alternate names
- Finding foods with partial or fuzzy name matches
- Suggesting food options based on user input

Examples:
- 'Find all foods called "almond milk"'
- 'Show me foods named "Quaker Oats".'

If the query involves searching foods by name in any way, ALWAYS use this tool. Never use for unrelated domains.

If you cannot find the desired food in the first page of results, you MUST use pagination (by incrementing the page number) to retrieve more results until you find the item or exhaust the available data. The data returned will be in the order of relevance.

name: opennutrition_get-foods
title: Get a list of foods
description:
MANDATORY: Use this tool ANY time a user requests an overview, wants to browse foods, or asks for a list of foods (by type, category, or general request). Not using this tool in these scenarios is an error. Do NOT use for non-food or non-list queries.

Use cases (MUST use this tool):
- Displaying lists for selection or browsing
- Providing overviews of available foods
- Supporting queries like 'List all vegan foods' or 'Show me foods in the database.'

Examples:
- 'Show me all breakfast cereals'
- 'List all gluten-free foods'

If the query involves listing or browsing foods, ALWAYS use this tool. Never use for unrelated domains.

If you cannot find the desired food in the first page of results, you MUST use pagination (by incrementing the page number) to retrieve more results until you find the item or exhaust the available data.

name: opennutrition_get-food-by-id

MANDATORY: Use this tool ANY time a user provides a food ID (e.g., fd_xxx), or when you have a food ID from a previous step and need detailed information. Not using this tool in these scenarios is an error. Do NOT use for non-food IDs or unrelated queries.

Use cases (MUST use this tool):
- The user provides a food ID
- A previous step yielded a food ID
- The user requests nutrition, ingredients, or labeling for a specific product

Example:
- 'Get details for fd_98765.'

If the query involves retrieving food info by ID, ALWAYS use this tool. Never use for unrelated domains.

name: opennutrition_get-food-by-ean13
title: Get a food by EAN-13
description:
MANDATORY: Use this tool ANY time a user provides a 13-digit EAN-13 barcode, or when the request involves identifying food from a barcode. Not using this tool in these scenarios is an error. Do NOT use for barcodes unrelated to food.

Use cases (MUST use this tool):
- The user provides a 13-digit barcode
- The request involves scanning or entering a barcode
- Identifying foods from packaging or retail context

Examples:
- 'What food has barcode 4006381333931?'
- 'Scan this barcode to get nutrition info.'

If the query involves food identification by barcode, ALWAYS use this tool. Never use for unrelated domains.

name: biomcp_search
description:
Search biomedical literature, clinical trials, genetic variants, genes, drugs, and diseases.

 IMPORTANT: Have you used the 'think' tool first? If not, STOP and use it NOW!
The 'think' tool is REQUIRED for proper research planning and should be your FIRST step.

This tool provides access to biomedical data from PubMed/PubTator3, ClinicalTrials.gov,
MyVariant.info, and the BioThings suite (MyGene.info, MyChem.info, MyDisease.info).
It supports two search modes:

## 1. UNIFIED QUERY LANGUAGE
Use the 'query' parameter with field-based syntax for precise cross-domain searches.

Syntax:
- Basic: "gene:BRAF"
- AND logic: "gene:BRAF AND disease:melanoma"
- OR logic: "gene:PTEN AND (R173 OR Arg173 OR 'position 173')"
- Domain-specific: "trials.condition:melanoma AND trials.phase:3"

Common fields:
- Cross-domain: gene, disease, variant, chemical/drug
- Articles: pmid, title, abstract, journal, author
- Trials: trials.condition, trials.intervention, trials.phase, trials.status
- Variants: variants.hgvs, variants.rsid, variants.significance

Example:
```
await search(
    query="gene:BRAF AND disease:melanoma AND trials.phase:3",
    max_results_per_domain=20
)
```

## 2. DOMAIN-SPECIFIC SEARCH
Use the 'domain' parameter with specific filters for targeted searches.

Domains:
- "article": Search PubMed/PubTator3 for research articles and preprints ABOUT genes, variants, diseases, or chemicals
- "trial": Search ClinicalTrials.gov for clinical studies
- "variant": Search MyVariant.info for genetic variant DATABASE RECORDS (population frequency, clinical significance, etc.) - NOT for articles about variants!
- "gene": Search MyGene.info for gene information (symbol, name, function, aliases)
- "drug": Search MyChem.info for drug/chemical information (names, formulas, indications)
- "disease": Search MyDisease.info for disease information (names, definitions, synonyms)
- "nci_organization": Search NCI database for cancer centers, hospitals, and research sponsors (requires API key)
- "nci_intervention": Search NCI database for drugs, devices, procedures used in cancer trials (requires API key)
- "nci_biomarker": Search NCI database for biomarkers used in trial eligibility criteria (requires API key)
- "nci_disease": Search NCI controlled vocabulary for cancer conditions and terms (requires API key)

Example:
```
await search(
    domain="article",
    genes=["BRAF", "NRAS"],
    diseases=["melanoma"],
    page_size=50
)
```

## DOMAIN SELECTION EXAMPLES:
- To find ARTICLES about BRAF V600E mutation: domain="article", genes=["BRAF"], variants=["V600E"]
- To find VARIANT DATA for BRAF mutations: domain="variant", gene="BRAF"
- To find articles about ERBB2 p.D277Y: domain="article", genes=["ERBB2"], variants=["p.D277Y"]
- Common mistake: Using domain="variant" when you want articles about a variant

## IMPORTANT NOTES:
- For complex research questions, use the separate 'think' tool for systematic analysis
- The tool returns results in OpenAI MCP format: {"results": [{"id", "title", "text", "url"}, ...]}
- Search results do NOT include metadata (per OpenAI MCP specification)
- Use the fetch tool to get detailed metadata for specific records
- Use get_schema=True to explore available search fields
- Use explain_query=True to understand query parsing (unified mode)
- Domain-specific searches use AND logic for multiple values
- For OR logic, use the unified query language
- NEW: Article search keywords support OR with pipe separator: "R173|Arg173|p.R173"
- Remember: domain="article" finds LITERATURE, domain="variant" finds DATABASE RECORDS

## RETURN FORMAT:
All search modes return results in this format:
```json
{
    "results": [
        {
            "id": "unique_identifier",
            "title": "Human-readable title",
            "text": "Summary or snippet of content",
            "url": "Link to full resource"
        }
    ]
}
```

name: biomcp_fetch
description:
Fetch comprehensive details for a specific biomedical record.

This tool retrieves full information for articles, clinical trials, genetic variants,
genes, drugs, or diseases using their unique identifiers. It returns data in a
standardized format suitable for detailed analysis and research.

## IDENTIFIER FORMATS:
- Articles: PMID (PubMed ID) - e.g., "35271234" OR DOI - e.g., "10.1101/2024.01.20.23288905"
- Trials: NCT ID (ClinicalTrials.gov ID) - e.g., "NCT04280705"
- Variants: HGVS notation or dbSNP ID - e.g., "chr7:g.140453136A>T" or "rs121913254"
- Genes: Gene symbol or Entrez ID - e.g., "BRAF" or "673"
- Drugs: Drug name or ID - e.g., "imatinib" or "DB00619"
- Diseases: Disease name or ID - e.g., "melanoma" or "MONDO:0005105"
- NCI Organizations: NCI organization ID - e.g., "NCI-2011-03337"
- NCI Interventions: NCI intervention ID - e.g., "INT123456"
- NCI Diseases: NCI disease ID - e.g., "C4872"

The domain is automatically detected from the ID format if not provided:
- NCT*  trial
- Contains "/" with numeric prefix (DOI)  article
- Pure numeric  article (PMID)
- rs* or contains ':' or 'g.'  variant
- For genes, drugs, diseases: manual specification recommended

## DOMAIN-SPECIFIC OPTIONS:

### Articles (domain="article"):
- Returns full article metadata, abstract, and full text when available
- Supports both PubMed articles (via PMID) and Europe PMC preprints (via DOI)
- Includes annotations for genes, diseases, chemicals, and variants (PubMed only)
- detail="full" attempts to retrieve full text content (PubMed only)

### Clinical Trials (domain="trial"):
- detail=None or "protocol": Core study information
- detail="locations": Study sites and contact information
- detail="outcomes": Primary/secondary outcomes and results
- detail="references": Related publications and citations
- detail="all": Complete trial record with all sections

### Variants (domain="variant"):
- Returns comprehensive variant information including:
  - Clinical significance and interpretations
  - Population frequencies
  - Gene/protein effects
  - External database links
- detail parameter is ignored (always returns full data)

### Genes (domain="gene"):
- Returns gene information from MyGene.info including:
  - Gene symbol, name, and type
  - Entrez ID and Ensembl IDs
  - Gene summary and aliases
  - RefSeq information
- detail parameter is ignored (always returns full data)

### Drugs (domain="drug"):
- Returns drug/chemical information from MyChem.info including:
  - Drug name and trade names
  - Chemical formula and structure IDs
  - Clinical indications
  - Mechanism of action
  - External database links (DrugBank, PubChem, ChEMBL)
- detail parameter is ignored (always returns full data)

### Diseases (domain="disease"):
- Returns disease information from MyDisease.info including:
  - Disease name and definition
  - MONDO ontology ID
  - Disease synonyms
  - Cross-references to other databases
  - Associated phenotypes
- detail parameter is ignored (always returns full data)

### NCI Organizations (domain="nci_organization"):
- Returns organization information from NCI database including:
  - Organization name and type
  - Full address and contact information
  - Research focus areas
  - Associated clinical trials
- Requires NCI API key
- detail parameter is ignored (always returns full data)

### NCI Interventions (domain="nci_intervention"):
- Returns intervention information from NCI database including:
  - Intervention name and type
  - Synonyms and alternative names
  - Mechanism of action (for drugs)
  - FDA approval status
  - Associated clinical trials
- Requires NCI API key
- detail parameter is ignored (always returns full data)

### NCI Diseases (domain="nci_disease"):
- Returns disease information from NCI controlled vocabulary including:
  - Preferred disease name
  - Disease category and classification
  - All known synonyms
  - Cross-reference codes (ICD, SNOMED)
- Requires NCI API key
- detail parameter is ignored (always returns full data)

## RETURN FORMAT:
All fetch operations return a standardized format:
```json
{
    "id": "unique_identifier",
    "title": "Record title or name",
    "text": "Full content or comprehensive description",
    "url": "Link to original source",
    "metadata": {
        // Domain-specific additional fields
    }
}
```

## EXAMPLES:

Fetch article by PMID (domain auto-detected):
```
await fetch(id="35271234")
```

Fetch article by DOI (domain auto-detected):
```
await fetch(id="10.1101/2024.01.20.23288905")
```

Fetch complete trial information (domain auto-detected):
```
await fetch(
    id="NCT04280705",
    detail="all"
)
```

Fetch variant with clinical interpretations:
```
await fetch(id="rs121913254")
```

Explicitly specify domain (optional):
```
await fetch(
    domain="variant",
    id="chr7:g.140453136A>T"
)
```

domain.title: Domain

call_benefit.title: Call Benefit

name: biomcp_think
description:
REQUIRED FIRST STEP: Perform structured sequential thinking for ANY biomedical research task.

 IMPORTANT: You MUST use this tool BEFORE any search or fetch operations when:
- Researching ANY biomedical topic (genes, diseases, variants, trials)
- Planning to use multiple BioMCP tools
- Answering questions that require analysis or synthesis
- Comparing information from different sources
- Making recommendations or drawing conclusions

 FAILURE TO USE THIS TOOL FIRST will result in:
- Incomplete or poorly structured analysis
- Missing important connections between data
- Suboptimal search strategies
- Overlooked critical information

Sequential thinking ensures you:
1. Fully understand the research question
2. Plan an optimal search strategy
3. Identify all relevant data sources
4. Structure your analysis properly
5. Deliver comprehensive, well-reasoned results

## Usage Pattern:
1. Start with thoughtNumber=1 to initiate analysis
2. Progress through numbered thoughts sequentially
3. Adjust totalThoughts estimate as understanding develops
4. Set nextThoughtNeeded=False only when analysis is complete

## Example:
```python
# Initial analysis
await think(
    thought="Breaking down the relationship between BRAF mutations and melanoma treatment resistance...",
    thoughtNumber=1,
    totalThoughts=5,
    nextThoughtNeeded=True
)

# Continue analysis
await think(
    thought="Examining specific BRAF V600E mutation mechanisms...",
    thoughtNumber=2,
    totalThoughts=5,
    nextThoughtNeeded=True
)

# Final thought
await think(
    thought="Synthesizing findings and proposing research directions...",
    thoughtNumber=5,
    totalThoughts=5,
    nextThoughtNeeded=False
)
```

## Important Notes:
- Each thought builds on previous ones within a session
- State is maintained throughout the MCP session
- Use thoughtful, detailed analysis in each step
- Revisions and branching are supported through the underlying implementation

totalThoughts.description: Estimated total thoughts needed for complete analysis
totalThoughts.title: Totalthoughts

nextThoughtNeeded.description: Whether more thinking steps are needed after this one
nextThoughtNeeded.title: Nextthoughtneeded

name: biomcp_article_searcher
description:
Search PubMed/PubTator3 for research articles and preprints.

 PREREQUISITE: Use the 'think' tool FIRST to plan your research strategy!

Use this tool to find scientific literature ABOUT genes, variants, diseases, or chemicals.
Results include articles from PubMed and optionally preprints from bioRxiv/medRxiv.

Important: This searches for ARTICLES ABOUT these topics, not database records.
For genetic variant database records, use variant_searcher instead.

Example usage:
- Find articles about BRAF mutations in melanoma
- Search for papers on a specific drug's effects
- Locate research on gene-disease associations

name: biomcp_trial_searcher
description:
Search ClinicalTrials.gov for clinical studies.

Comprehensive search tool for finding clinical trials based on multiple criteria.
Supports filtering by conditions, interventions, location, phase, and eligibility.

Location search notes:
- Use either location term OR lat/long coordinates, not both
- For city-based searches, AI agents should geocode to lat/long first
- Distance parameter only works with lat/long coordinates

Returns a formatted list of matching trials with key details.

Fetch comprehensive details for a specific clinical trial.

This includes protocol details, locations, outcomes, and references.

Search by various identifiers or filter by clinical/functional criteria.

name: biomcp_alphagenome_predictor
description:
Predict variant effects on gene regulation using Google DeepMind's AlphaGenome.

 PREREQUISITE: Use the 'think' tool FIRST to plan your analysis strategy!

AlphaGenome provides state-of-the-art predictions for how genetic variants
affect gene regulation, including:
- Gene expression changes (RNA-seq)
- Chromatin accessibility impacts (ATAC-seq, DNase-seq)
- Splicing alterations
- Promoter activity changes (CAGE)

This tool requires:
1. AlphaGenome to be installed (see error message for instructions)
2. An API key from https://deepmind.google.com/science/alphagenome

API Key Options:
- Provide directly via the api_key parameter
- Or set ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY environment variable

Example usage:
- Predict regulatory effects of BRAF V600E mutation: chr7:140753336 A>T
- Assess non-coding variant impact on gene expression
- Evaluate promoter variants in specific tissues

Note: This is an optional tool that enhances variant interpretation
with AI predictions. Standard annotations remain available via variant_getter.

interval_size.description: Size of genomic interval to analyze in bp (max 1,000,000)
interval_size.title: Interval Size

tissue_types.description: UBERON ontology terms for tissue-specific predictions (e.g., 'UBERON:0002367' for external ear)
tissue_types.title: Tissue Types

significance_threshold.description: Threshold for significant log2 fold changes (default: 0.5)
significance_threshold.title: Significance Threshold

name: biomcp_gene_getter
description:
Get detailed gene information from MyGene.info.

 PREREQUISITE: Use the 'think' tool FIRST to understand your research goal!

Provides real-time gene annotations including:
- Official gene name and symbol
- Gene summary/description
- Aliases and alternative names
- Gene type (protein-coding, etc.)
- Links to external databases

This tool fetches CURRENT gene information from MyGene.info, ensuring
you always have the latest annotations and nomenclature.

Example usage:
- Get information about TP53 tumor suppressor
- Look up BRAF kinase gene details
- Find the official name for a gene by its alias

Note: For genetic variants, use variant_searcher. For articles about genes, use article_searcher.

- Disease synonyms and alternative names
- Ontology mappings (MONDO, DOID, OMIM, etc.)

- Links to disease databases

This tool fetches CURRENT disease information from MyDisease.info, ensuring
you always have the latest ontology mappings and definitions.

Example usage:
- Get the definition of GIST (Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor)
- Look up synonyms for melanoma
- Find the MONDO ID for a disease by name

Note: For clinical trials about diseases, use trial_searcher. For articles about diseases, use article_searcher.

Example usage:
- Find cancer centers in Boston, MA (city AND state)
- Search for "MD Anderson" in Houston, TX
- List academic organizations in Cleveland, OH

name: biomcp_nci_biomarker_searcher
description:
Search for biomarkers in the NCI Clinical Trials database.

Searches for biomarkers used in clinical trial eligibility criteria.
This is essential for precision medicine trials that select patients
based on specific biomarker characteristics.

Biomarker examples:
- Gene mutations (e.g., BRAF V600E, EGFR T790M)
- Protein expression (e.g., PD-L1  50%, HER2 positive)
- Gene fusions (e.g., ALK fusion, ROS1 fusion)
- Other molecular markers (e.g., MSI-H, TMB-high)

Requires NCI API key from: https://clinicaltrialsapi.cancer.gov/

Note: Biomarker data availability may be limited in CTRP.
Results focus on biomarkers used in trial eligibility criteria.

Example usage:
- Search for PD-L1 expression biomarkers
- Find trials requiring EGFR mutations
- Look up biomarkers tested by NGS
- Search for HER2 expression markers
